emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Full Stack Developer
emerging_technologies.description: An AI system capable of autonomously designing, coding, testing, and deploying software applications from high-level requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the need for human coders, potentially leading to job displacement but also allowing for rapid software development and innovation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High adoption in industries with a demand for rapid iteration and scalability, ethical concerns regarding AI's role in creative and decision-making processes.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuralink Commercial Release
emerging_technologies.description: A commercial version of Neuralink allowing for brain-computer interfaces for both medical and entertainment purposes.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances cognitive abilities, raises significant ethical questions about privacy, consent, and human augmentation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption limited by regulatory hurdles, public perception of brain implants, and cost-effectiveness.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Solar Power Satellites
emerging_technologies.description: Satellites designed to collect solar power in space and beam it down to Earth for consumption.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could provide clean energy, reducing dependency on fossil fuels, but requires significant investment and international cooperation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Initial high costs, geopolitical challenges, and the need for global agreements on space utilization.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Digital Identity
emerging_technologies.description: A blockchain-based system allowing individuals to control and share their personal data securely across the web.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances privacy and control over personal data, could reduce identity theft but might face resistance from centralized data entities.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: User demand for privacy, regulatory support for data sovereignty, technical challenges in integration with existing systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Assisted Software Development
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that assist in coding, debugging, and optimizing software, becoming standard in the development ecosystem.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted due to productivity gains, with ongoing training for developers to work alongside AI systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport
mainstream_technologies.description: Self-driving vehicles and drones for urban transport, significantly reducing human-driven traffic.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Broad adoption in progressive cities, supported by regulatory frameworks and infrastructure changes.

epoch_themes.description: AI becomes ubiquitous, assisting in everything from personal tasks to complex professional workflows.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Transforms how individuals interact with technology, potentially leading to increased productivity and new forms of social interaction.
epoch_themes.global_trends: A push towards AI education, ethical AI use, and regulatory frameworks to manage AI's role in society.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies focused on reducing environmental impact become central to global innovation efforts.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Encourages a shift towards renewable energy and sustainable practices, influencing policy and consumer behavior.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in green technologies, international collaboration on climate change solutions.
